You have a 120x120 grid. Each cell has a belt that can face either right or down.  

Initially, a slime ball is on the belt of cell (0,0) and all other belts are empty.

Every second, the following happens:

1. All slime balls move one cell in the direction of their belt. If a slime ball reaches the edge of the grid, it is removed. If two slime balls land on the same cell, they merge into one.
2. All belts that had a slime ball on them in the previous second change direction (right becomes down, down becomes right).
3. A new slime ball is placed on cell (0,0).

You are given  *q* queries, each asking if there is a slime ball in cell (x,y) after *t* seconds. 

For each query, output "YES" if there is a slime ball in cell (x,y) after *t* seconds, and "NO" otherwise.

A conveyor belt has 120 rows and 120 columns.  A slime ball starts at the top left corner. Every second, the slime ball moves in the direction the belt is facing. If it hits the edge, it falls off. If two slime balls meet, they combine.  The direction of all belts changes at the same time. A new slime ball appears at the top left corner each second.  

You are given a time and a location.  Determine if a slime ball will be at that location at that time.
